title: Folder not appearing in Folder Panel
content: I imported my profile from a PC to a MacBook Air and it went quite well. However, one of the mail folders that I can see in my new profile on the MacBook is not appearing on the Folder Pane when I open Thunderbird. It's part of my Local Folders so I tried to add a folder of the same name and it told me that there was already a folder by that name. So it's definitely there but just inaccessible through the Folder Pane. Is there a magic way to get all folders to show up?
creator: pkcweir

title: Account Removal Option Disappeared?
content: I would like to remove my email account. There are explanations here about finding a 'remove account' option in settings but it appears that the option has recently disappeared. How do I remove an account?
creator: forstori

title: every time I restart Thunderbird it looses my tab settings
content: Every time I restart Thunderbird it looses my tab settings, I use many open tabs one for each email accounts inbox and then a few more, after a restart, I am force to close all except the first and the calendar and chats which are fine, and then manually open them all again, this needs fixing
creator: grizzlysmit

title: Problems with Thunderbird
content: Earlier this evening, I restarted my Mac computer, and inexplicably found that all of my email sub-folders had mysteriously disappeared. I spent hours attempting to recover five years worth of data through online means, with absolutely no success. I eventually made a donation to Mozilla in order to hopefully reinstall this program in a desperate attempt recover all of these files, but have still made no progress. Please, please help me to recover this information. Thank you in advance for any help you can offer.
creator: Trashfiend

title: Recover emails from removed email account - MAC
content: Recently changed email servers. Under account actions selected "Remove Account" so it wouldn't reach out to the old ISP. Thought I had checked "Remove Account Information", but not Remove Message Data". Entire account disappeared. I've read the emails are still in a profile. How can I recover lost emails?

creator: karl.koch43

title: Fresh install Ubuntu 24.04: thunderbird cannot send emails anymore
content:
Hi,

I have been using Thunderbird happily for a long time, most recently version 115.13.0 on my Ubuntu 22.04 partition. Recently I installed Ubuntu 24.04 on another partition, including Thunderbird 128.0esr, now installed as a snap package (it's a recent change in Ubuntu; instead of apt package previously).

The new Thunderbird correctly reads my emails (imap) but it cannot send emails, save drafts or mark emails as read on the server. So I have Thunderbird 115 on the old partition working perfectly, but Thunderbird 128 not working on the same GMail account (I also have the same problem with another non-GMail account). I checked the smtp settings carefully, they are identical between the two versions.

It's possible I made a mistake, but I'm at a loss about what is wrong. How can I diagnose and solve this problem?

(I know that I could reinstall Thunderbird with the apt package, but I assume that the snap package should work too and I would like to understand the cause)

I'd be grateful for any advice
creator: erwan.more

title: Tbird 115.10.1 crashing in garbage collect
content:
See 7a70ec71-3686-4468-8647-4d6da0240727. This seems to be a recent and persistent issue. I've rebuilt the global index and several mailboxes. Activity Manager shows a real drop in the performance of indexing a mailbox (it gets slower and slower), eventually resulting in a crash.

Side note: the message "Indexing {X} of {Y} messages in {folder_name}..." would be infinitely more helpful if the message also mentioned which account that folder was in.
creator: firefox.sync.osn4wd

title: Conversation threading
